title: Service-Learning-Based Mathematics Education Design Process

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Mastery of Core Instructional Design Theories
context.additional_context: Adult learners design mathematics education programs to solve community problems, emphasizing the application of theory to practice

learning_goals: Learners can conduct customized mathematics education design by analyzing actual community educational needs

During a 6-month service-learning project, learners analyze 10+ customer service scenarios, complete 3 team assignments on time using project management tools (Trello, Asana, etc.), and achieve "excellent" ratings in 4 or more of 5 communication competency items in peer evaluations and mentor feedback

Through weekly reflective practice journals, learners specify 3 educational strengths and 2 areas for improvement, and achieve an average score of 4 or higher (5-point scale) in peer feedback and expert evaluation rubrics (bias-reduction attitude)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
